isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 146). Keep keyway in the mainshaft clear for insertion of the mainshaft key.

figure.caption: Figure 146. Secure Mainshaft in Vise

note.para: Each mainshaft gear is held in position by locking a tolerance washer to the mainshaft with a mainshaft key. There is one tolerance washer for each gear. Tolerance washers for reverse, LO, 1st, and 2nd speed gears are the same diameter; the 3rd speed tolerance washer is a smaller diameter.

step1.para: Install the reverse gear tolerance washer in the groove near the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 147).

figure.caption: Figure 147. Install Reverse Gear Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Rotate the tolerance washer in the groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with the splines of the mainshaft. Install the mainshaft key in the keyway to lock washer in place ( Figure 148).

figure.caption: Figure 148. Install Mainshaft Key in Keyway to Lock Washer in Place

note.para: Make sure the mainshaft key is positioned with the word "TOP" to the outside. Procedure of rotating the tolerance washer will be followed each time a tolerance washer is installed on the mainshaft.

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the tolerance washer with the clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Install Reverse Gear on Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear on the mainshaft with the clutching teeth facing up ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 150. Install Auxiliary Drive Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 151).

figure.caption: Figure 151. Install Snap Ring in Groove at Rear of Mainshaft

para.emph: Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft Gears ( Figure 152)

figure.caption: Figure 152. Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft Gears

svcproc.para: Axial Clearance (End Play) Limits are .005"- .012" for all mainshaft gears
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style tolerance washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .259-.261.)

step1.para: Insert two screwdrivers between the hub of the reverse gear and the auxiliary drive gear ( Figure 153). Apply slight downward pressure on the screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly apart. Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance should be from .005" to .012". If the clearance is less than the minimum .005" tolerance, the tolerance washer in the reverse gear should be replaced by a thinner tolerance washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012" tolerance, a thicker tolerance washer should be installed in the reverse gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 153. Insert Screwdrivers Between Hub of Reverse Gear and Auxiliary Drive Gear

step1.para: After the proper reverse gear clearance has been set, remove the snap ring from the rear of the mainshaft. Remove the auxiliary drive gear and the reverse gear from the mainshaft. The tolerance washer and key remain on the mainshaft. Reposition the mainshaft in a vise, pilot end up, so that the keyway is accessible ( Figure 154).

figure.caption: Figure 154. Reposition Mainshaft in Vise

step1.para: Install the LO-reverse speed clutch on the mainshaft against the reverse gear tolerance washer. Align slot in the sliding clutch with the key on the mainshaft ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Install LO-Reverse Speed Clutch on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft key from the mainshaft. Install LO speed gear tolerance washer on the mainshaft LO speed gear location and re-install the mainshaft key to lock the tolerance washer to the shaft ( Figure 156).

figure.caption: Figure 156. Install LO Speed Gear Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Install LO speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down, and engage with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 157).

figure.caption: Figure 157. Install LO Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the 1st speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth up ( Figure 158).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Install 1st Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft key from the keyway. Install 1st speed gear tolerance washer on the mainshaft and into the hub of 1st speed gear ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Install 1st Speed Gear Tolerance Washer

caution.para: Care should be used to prevent mainshaft gears from dropping to the bottom of the mainshaft.

step1.para: Install the mainshaft key in the keyway to lock the tolerance washer to the shaft ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Install Mainshaft Key in Keyway

step1.para: Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the LO and 1st speed gears as described in Step 7 ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 1st-2nd speed sliding clutch, aligning the slot of the sliding clutch with the key; engage with 1st speed gear ( Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Install 1st-2nd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft key and install 2nd gear tolerance washer at 2nd speed gear location ( Figure 163). Install the mainshaft key. It will be necessary to pull the mainshaft key upward slightly to fit the key in the keyway. Reposition the key so that it rests on the mainshaft groove shoulder (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Install 2nd Gear Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft and engage with the external splines of the tolerance washer, clutching teeth down ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 3rd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth up ( Figure 165).

figure.caption: Figure 165. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install a tolerance washer in the bore of 3rd speed gear ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Install Tolerance Washer in Bore of 3rd Speed Gear

step1.para: Install snap ring ( inset, Figure 167) in the snap ring groove. This will hold 3rd speed gear in position on the mainshaft. Check the axial clearance and make adjustments, if necessary, between 2nd and 3rd speed gears, as described in Step 7.

figure.caption: Figure 167. Install Snap Ring and Check Axial Clearance

step1.para: Install the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch on the mainshaft with "FRONT" up ( Figure 168). Align the slot in the sliding clutch with the key and engage the clutch with 3rd speed gear.

figure.caption: Figure 168. Install 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch on Mainshaft

important.para: Mark timing teeth on the drive gear (4th speed gear) with a highly visible color of toolmaker's dye ( Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Mark Timing Teeth on Drive Gear

step2.para: Mark two adjacent teeth on the drive gear.
Mark two adjacent teeth on the drive gear which are directly opposite the first set marked. There should be the same number of teeth between markings on each side of the gear.

step1.para: Install the drive gear (4th gear) on the mainshaft, clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Install Drive Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise and install the reverse gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 171).

figure.caption: Figure 171. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft
